alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 4:01AM PST until January 08 at 4:25AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County. .Heavy rain over the South Slopes of the Olympics and in the lowlands along the Central Coast and Southwest Interior Thursday pushed the Satsop River near Satsop above flood stage. The river will crest this morning then slowly recede this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Satsop River Near Satsop. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood...inundating farms...roads...and some residential areas. Erosion will likely damage some areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Friday the stage was 39.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM PST Friday was 39.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 40.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 145 PM PST.
